commitResults.messageTitle: Rename, Greet, and Exit
Edited to echo commands entered by user, exits when user enters bye
Added a list to store tasks, and list items in list
Added mark and unmark feature
Added task types: Todos, Deadlines, Events.
Edited System.out.println when adding Todos, Deadlines, Events to list
Added automated text UI testing
Added error messages for invalid inputs.
Add support for deleting tasks from the list.
Separate classes Task, Todo, Deadline and Event from main method
commitResults.messageBody: For better organization of classes from the main method

commitResults.messageTitle: Rename file Duke.java to Scribbles.java
commitResults.messageBody: Rename file to match with new chatbot name

commitResults.messageTitle: Scribbles.java: Add loadFileData method
commitResults.messageBody:
Data from the hard disk needs to be loaded to program when chatbot starts up.

Method is called when main() is ran and the data from hard disk is loaded into the chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Scribbles.java: Add saveFileData method
commitResults.messageBody:
Update the hard disk whenever changes to tasks are made

This saves the data to the hard disk such that when main() is ran again, it is able to load data from the previous use of the chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-Level-7:
  Scribbles.java: Add saveFileData method
  Scribbles.java: Add loadFileData method
  Rename file Duke.java to Scribbles.java
  Separate classes Task, Todo, Deadline and Event from main method

commitResults.messageTitle: Scribbles.java: Add file and directory check
commitResults.messageBody: Checks if the file path used by the chatbot exists in the user's computer. If it does not, it will create the directory and the file in the user's computer to save data.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-Level-7:
  Scribbles.java: Add file and directory check

commitResults.messageTitle: Event.java: Change the start and end type to LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody:
Scribbles can now recognize the start and end in Event as a date and time.

Prints stored start date/time and end date/time in the format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm" such that it is readable to users of the chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Scribbles.java: Edit all methods affected by the change in type of end and start of Event from String to LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody:
Scribbles now recognize start and end of Event as a date/time.

Edit,
* addEvent method to convert String input of user in format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm" to date/time of type LocalDateTime
* addEvent method to print error message if date/time is in incorrect format
* loadFileData method to add saved date/time of Event to LocalDateTime before adding to taskList
* loadFileData method to print error message if date/time for Event stored are of incorrect format
* saveFileData method to save to file date/time of Event as String in the format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm" from type LocalDateTime

commitResults.messageTitle: Deadline.java: Edit type of By to be LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot is able to recognise By as a LocalDateTime

Edit,
* Type of By from String to LocalDateTime
* getBy() method to return By in LocalDateTime
* Add getByString() method to return By in String format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm"
* toString() method to return By in String format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm" that is readable to user

commitResults.messageTitle: Scribbles.java: Edit methods that are affected by change of type of By to LocalDateTime in Deadline.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Change of type of By from String to LocalDateTime will cause bugs in methods that are affected.

Edit,
* addDeadline method to read deadline input in String format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm" and store it as a LocalDateTime in taskList
* addDeadline method to print a warning if input is not in String format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm"
* loadFileData to add deadlines stored in hard disk in the String format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm" to taskList as LocalDateTime
* saveFileData to save Deadline to harddisk of type LocalDateTime to String format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm"

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-8'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-Level-8:
  Scribbles.java: Edit methods that are affected by change of type of By to LocalDateTime in Deadline.java
  Deadline.java: Edit type of By to be LocalDateTime
  Scribbles.java: Edit all methods affected by the change in type of end and start of Event from String to LocalDateTime
  Event.java: Change the start and end type to LocalDateTime

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new classes Ui.java, TaskList.java, Storage.java and Parser.java.
commitResults.messageBody:
This makes the code more OOP.

* class Ui.java: deals with interactions with the user
* class Storage.java: deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
* class Parser.java: deals with making sense of the user command
* class TaskList.java: contains the task list

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-OOP-Increment'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-OOP-Increment:
  Add new classes Ui.java, TaskList.java, Storage.java and Parser.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create package for classes.
commitResults.messageBody:
Organise classes into suitable packages.

Create,
* task package for Task.java, Todo.java, Deadline.java, Event.java
* parser package for Parser.java
* storage package for Storage.java
* ui package for Ui.java

Add import statements to affect classes to allow use of classes in other packages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Package-Increment'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-Package-Increment:
  Create package for classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge commit 'a6f73244a20539e20c2189973ebf597df34ef631'
commitResults.messageBody:
* commit 'a6f73244a20539e20c2189973ebf597df34ef631':
  Bump gradle and lib version
  Add Gradle support
  docs/README.md: Tweak document template

commitResults.messageTitle: ScribblesTest.java: Create JUnit test for parseInput(String input) method in Scribbles.java.
commitResults.messageBody:
Automate the testing of parseInput for different input to ensure the right output.

Wrote test cases for all possible inputs.

commitResults.messageTitle: ParserTest.java: Create JUnit tests for isMissingDeadlineInformation() method in Parser class
commitResults.messageBody:
Automate the testing of isMissingDeadlineInformation for different inputs to ensure the right output.
It should return true if any inputs for deadlines are missing relevant information, and true otherwise, or throw IndexOutOfBoundsException

Wrote test cases for all possible inputs.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-JUnit-Increment'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-JUnit-Increment:
  ParserTest.java: Create JUnit tests for isMissingDeadlineInformation() method in Parser class
  ScribblesTest.java: Create JUnit test for parseInput(String input) method in Scribbles.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments to code.
commitResults.messageBody: Explain the use of the different methods and classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-JavaDoc'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-A-JavaDoc:
  Add JavaDoc comments to code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit code to comply with coding standards.
commitResults.messageBody:
Complying with coding standards will help to improve code quality.

Edit,
* boolean methods and variables to sound like booleans — completed to isCompleted, parsedInput to isParsedInput
* indentation for switch statements — remove the indentation in front of case clauses

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-A-CodingStandard'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-A-CodingStandard:
  Edit code to comply with coding standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser.java: Change split method input from ("\\s+") to ("\\s+", 2)
commitResults.messageBody: The error was causing to-do tasks description with a space in between to only store the first word.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add feature that give users a way to search for tasks using a keyword.
commitResults.messageBody:
Users can easily search for tasks with a keyword instead of looking through the whole list of tasks.

Add,
* getFindKeyword() method to Parser.java that returns the keyword in the user's input
* find case clause for the actions to perform after a find command
* new instruction under invalidInputMessage to direct users on how to use find command
* taskWithKeyword method Ui.java class that lists all the tasks with the keyword
* missingKeywordMessage() method that prints an error message if users do not include a keyword in their find command

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-9'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-Level-9:
  Add feature that give users a way to search for tasks using a keyword.
  Parser.java: Change split method input from ("\\s+") to ("\\s+", 2)

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: allow todo tasks to accept a description
commitResults.messageBody:
Split string in getTodoDescription() split the string wrongly causing
it to throw an IndexOutOfBoundsException all the time.

Change ("\\s+, 2") to ("\\s+", 2).

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: edit line spacing of scribbles messages
commitResults.messageBody:
some replies include a line spacing after and some do not which
makes it seem messy.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: add checkstyle feature and edit checkstyle errors
Merge branch 'branch-CheckStyle'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-CheckStyle:
  fix: add checkstyle feature and edit checkstyle errors

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: change icon for GUI and edit some view features
fix: edit javadocs
fix: change minimum height of dialog box and edit gui aesthetics
commitResults.messageBody:
messages that exceed height indicated would automatically be
truncated with "...".

update the dialog box minimum height such that the minimum height is
USE_PREF_SIZE.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-10'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-Level-10:
  fix: change minimum height of dialog box and edit gui aesthetics

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: change marking completed icons to be constant strings
commitResults.messageBody:
changing the icons to constant string help to avoid magic literals as
it makes it clearer what they icons represent

add private static final String COMPLETED_ICON and INCOMPLETED_ICON

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: edit help message to be more informative and fix typos
feat: add java assertions to code
commitResults.messageBody:
java assertions help to document important assumptions that should hold
at various points of the code

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: change the dateTimeFormat of Parser class to a constant
commitResults.messageBody:
same date time format is used throughout the class.
improves code quality by avoiding magic literals.

add private static final DATE_TIME_FORMAT.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: split getResponse method and add another method respondToCommand
commitResults.messageBody:
improve code quality by avoiding multiple levels of abstraction within
the getResponse method.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #1 from danielleloh/branch-A-Assertions
commitResults.messageBody: feat: add java assertions to code

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #2 from danielleloh/branch-A-CodeQuality
commitResults.messageBody: feat: edit to improve code quality

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add feature to allow users to sort the tasks in their task list
commitResults.messageBody:
users may find it neater to sort their tasks for neater organisation

allowed sorting orders:
* date
* description
* completed first
* incompleted first
* type of task

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-BCD-Extensions'
commitResults.messageBody:
* branch-BCD-Extensions:
  feat: add feature to allow users to sort the tasks in their task list

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: update javadocs for new methods added
fix: fix gui such that user inputs are aligned to the right
fix: change mainClassName in build.gradle to set new entry point of the application to scribbles.Launcher instead of scribbles.Scribbles
feat: improve GUI to make it look more polished
commitResults.messageBody:
add,
* chat boxes surrounding dialog of Scribbles and User
* different fonts to accommodate windows users and macbook users
* different display image to look better and clearer
* different colours to the chat box and text for dialog of Scribbles
and User

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add quitting of program after user input "bye"
commitResults.messageBody:
the chatbot only responds to bye initially but does not completely
exit and shut down the program.

add a 2 second delay after bye for the program to shut down.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: disallow the input of event start date/time to be later than event end date/time
commitResults.messageBody:
it does not make sense for the start of the event to be later than the
end of the event

chatbot does not allow the addition of such event and prints a message
to inform users that the input start is later than the input end

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: change filepath of where there data is stored so that it will can work when converted to a JAR file
fix: edit warning message to be clearer when file date is corrupted
fix: add javadocs for methods
fix: edit name of directory for filepath for Scribbles
commitResults.messageBody:
the name is edited to be more specific that it is linked to Scribbles
so that users know which file contains information for Scribbles.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: add class CommandResponder to deal with responding to commands made by the user
commitResults.messageBody:
this resolves the very-long method, respondToCommand, which was
initially in the Scribbles class by further abstracting the method.
This also improves OOP as the response to the commands is dealt with in
a separate class.

add,
* new class CommandResponder
* methods for the different commands
* javadocs for the new methods in CommandResponder

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: update junit testing to accomodate new or removed methods
fix: add response to "bye" and other input command into CommandResponder folder
commitResults.messageBody:
This improves OOP as it improve encapsulation as all response to
commands are not encapsulated in the CommandResponder class.

commitResults.messageBody: introduces Scribbles to potential users

blank lines help to separate the content more visibly allowing for
